Package com.google.api.client.auth.oauth2

OAuth 2.0 authorization as specified in The OAuth 2.0 Protocol (draft-ietf-oauth-v2-07) (see detailed package specification).

See:
          Description

Class Summary
AbstractAuthorizationRequestUrl OAuth 2.0 URL builder for an authorization web page to allow the end user to authorize the application to access their protected resources as specified in User-Agent Flow.
AbstractAuthorizationResponse OAuth 2.0 parser for the redirect URL after end user grants or denies authorization as specified in Authorization Server Response
AccessProtectedResource OAuth 2.0 methods for specifying the access token parameter as specified in Accessing a Protected Resource.
AccessTokenErrorResponse OAuth 2.0 access token error response as specified in Error Response.
AccessTokenRequest OAuth 2.0 request for an access token as specified in Obtaining an Access Token.
AccessTokenResponse OAuth 2.0 access token success response content as specified in Access Token Response.
AssertionAccessTokenRequest OAuth 2.0 Assertion Flow: request an access token based on as assertion as specified in Assertion.
RefreshAccessTokenRequest OAuth 2.0 request to refresh an access token as specified in Refreshing an Access Token.
ResourceOwnerCredentialsAccessTokenRequest OAuth 2.0 Username and Password Flow: request an access token based on resource owner credentials used in the as specified in Resource Owner Credentials.
UserAgentAuthorizationRequestUrl OAuth 2.0 User Agent Flow: URL builder for an authorization web page endpoint to allow the end user to authorize the application to access their protected resources.
UserAgentAuthorizationResponse OAuth 2.0 User Agent Flow: parses the redirect URL fragment after end user grants or denies authorization as specified in Authorization Server Response
VerificationCodeAccessTokenRequest OAuth 2.0 Web Server Flow: request an access token based on a verification code as specified in Verification Code.
WebServerAuthorizationRequestUrl OAuth 2.0 Web Server Flow: URL builder for an authorization web page to allow the end user to authorize the application to access their protected resources.
WebServerAuthorizationResponse OAuth 2.0 Web Server Flow: parser for the redirect URL after end user grants or denies authorization.
 

Package com.google.api.client.auth.oauth2 Description

OAuth 2.0 authorization as specified in The OAuth 2.0 Protocol (draft-ietf-oauth-v2-07) (see detailed package specification).

Before using this library, you may need to register your application with the authorization server to receive a client ID and client secret.

The starting point for each Client Flow depends on which Flow you are using:

  • Web Server Flow: WebServerAuthorizationRequestUrl
  • User Agent Flow: UserAgentAuthorizationRequestUrl
  • Username and Password Flow: ResourceOwnerCredentialsAccessTokenRequest
  • Client Credentials Flow: AccessTokenRequest
  • Assertion Flow: AssertionAccessTokenRequest

This package depends on the com.google.api.client.http, com.google.api.client.json, and com.google.api.client.util packages.

Warning: this package is experimental, and its content may be changed in incompatible ways or possibly entirely removed in a future version of the library

Since:
1.0
